solution_line_template: Since it is {percentage_increase}% taller, then {current_height_inches} inches is {initial_percentage}% + {percentage_increase}% = {total_percentage}% of its height then.
So each 1% is equal to {current_height_inches}/{total_percentage} = <<{current_height_inches}/{total_percentage}={inches_per_percent}>>{inches_per_percent} inches.
So, its height then was {inches_per_percent} x {initial_percentage}% = {original_height_inches} inches.

Since 1 foot is equal to {inches_per_foot} inches, then {original_height_inches} inches is equal to {original_height_inches}/{inches_per_foot} = <<{original_height_inches}/{inches_per_foot}={original_height_feet}>>{original_height_feet} feet.
